description: Complete semester lifecycle from program configuration through audit close-out, showcasing multi-tenant institution management, course setup, faculty invitations, assessment submission, and audit approval workflow.
talking_points: Natural keys keep sessions stable across reseeds (/logout resets quickly)
Duplicate button accelerates version 2 courses and multi-program coverage
Email previews land in logs/email.log, so demos don't rely on external inboxes
Audit approvals instantly feed dashboard KPIs—closed loop

steps.name: Verify Server Health
steps.purpose: Confirm Flask server is running and responding

instructions.human: The server should already be running from environment setup. This step verifies it's responding.

steps.name: Admin Login
steps.purpose: Establish admin session for program and course configuration

pre_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users WHERE email='demo2025.admin@example.com' AND role='institution_admin'"
pre_commands.purpose: Verify admin user exists in database

instructions.human: Navigate to the login page and sign in with the admin credentials provided below.

expected_results: Admin name visible in header dropdown

steps.name: Edit Biology Program Description
steps.purpose: Update program metadata to align with current accreditation cycle

pre_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT id FROM programs WHERE name='Biological Sciences' LIMIT 1"

instructions.human:
1. Click 'Programs' in the navigation or dashboard
2. Find 'Biological Sciences' in the table
3. Click the Edit button (pencil icon)
4. Change description to: 'Primary focus for Fall 2024 Accreditation Cycle.'
5. Click Save

data.description: Primary focus for Fall 2024 Accreditation Cycle.

inputs.new_description: Primary focus for Fall 2024 Accreditation Cycle.

post_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT description FROM programs WHERE name='Biological Sciences'"
post_commands.purpose: Verify description was updated in database

steps.name: Navigate to Courses Page
steps.purpose: Access course management interface for duplication

instructions.human: Click 'Courses' in the navigation menu or dashboard to view the course listing.

expected_results: Course table loads with multiple courses visible
BIOL-101 and ZOOL-101 courses visible in the list

steps.name: Duplicate BIOL-101 Course
steps.purpose: Demonstrate course versioning and multi-program attachment

pre_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT id FROM courses WHERE course_number='BIOL-101' LIMIT 1"
sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT id FROM programs WHERE name='Biological Sciences' LIMIT 1"
sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT id FROM programs WHERE name='Zoology' LIMIT 1"

instructions.human:
1. Find 'BIOL-101 Introduction to Biology' in the course table
2. Click the Duplicate button (copy icon)
3. In the modal:
   - Change Course Number to 'BIOL-101-V2'
   - Keep title and description
   - In Programs dropdown, select BOTH 'Biological Sciences' AND 'Zoology' (multi-program attachment)
4. Click 'Duplicate' button
5. Verify 'BIOL-101-V2' appears in the course list

automated.description: Duplicate BIOL-101 and attach to both programs

expected_results: BIOL-101-V2 appears in the course table
New course is attached to both Biological Sciences and Zoology programs

post_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT course_number, course_title FROM courses WHERE course_number='BIOL-101-V2'"
sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM course_programs cp JOIN courses c ON cp.course_id = c.id WHERE c.course_number='BIOL-101-V2'"
post_commands.purpose: Verify course is attached to 2 programs

steps.name: Logout as Admin
steps.purpose: End admin session before logging in as faculty

instructions.human: Click the user dropdown in the header and select 'Logout'.

steps.name: Login as Biology Faculty (Dr. Morgan)
steps.purpose: Establish faculty session for assessment submission

pre_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users WHERE email='dr.morgan@demo.example.com' AND role='instructor'"

instructions.human: Navigate to the login page and sign in with Dr. Morgan's credentials.

steps.name: Navigate to Assessments Page

instructions.human: Click 'Assessments' in the navigation menu to access the course assessment form.

expected_results: Course dropdown populated with Dr. Morgan's courses

steps.name: Fill Out Assessment Form for BIOL-101
steps.purpose: Submit section-level assessment data and narrative

pre_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT cs.id FROM course_sections cs JOIN course_offerings co ON cs.offering_id = co.id JOIN courses c ON co.course_id = c.id WHERE c.course_number='BIOL-101' AND cs.section_number='001' LIMIT 1"

instructions.human:
1. Select 'Fall 2024 - BIOL-101 - Section 001' from the course dropdown
2. Fill in the following:
   - Students Passed (A/B/C): 20
   - Students D/F/Incomplete: 5
   - What Went Well: 'Students demonstrated strong understanding of cell biology fundamentals. Lab work showed particular excellence in microscopy techniques.'
3. Click 'Save Course Data'
4. Verify success message appears at bottom of page

data.narrative_celebrations: Students demonstrated strong understanding of cell biology fundamentals. Lab work showed particular excellence in microscopy techniques.

automated.description: Save assessment data for BIOL-101 Section 001

inputs.narrative_celebrations: Students demonstrated strong understanding of cell biology fundamentals. Lab work showed particular excellence in microscopy techniques.

expected_results: Form fields populate with entered data
Success message appears: 'Course data saved successfully'
CLO assessment section appears with Update Assessment buttons

post_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT students_passed, students_dfic FROM course_sections cs JOIN course_offerings co ON cs.offering_id = co.id JOIN courses c ON co.course_id = c.id WHERE c.course_number='BIOL-101' AND cs.section_number='001'"

steps.name: Logout as Faculty
steps.purpose: End faculty session before admin audit phase

instructions.human: Click the user dropdown and select 'Logout'.

steps.name: Advance Demo State to Semester End
steps.purpose: Populate database with submitted CLOs across all statuses for audit demonstration

instructions.human:
This step runs automatically. It creates CLOs in various states:
- 2 CLOs 'Awaiting Approval'
- 1 CLO 'Approved'
- 1 CLO 'Needs Rework'
- 1 CLO 'Never Coming In'

expected_results: Log shows CLO creation for BIOL-101 and ZOOL-101
Database now contains 5 CLOs in various approval states

post_commands.command: sqlite3 course_records_dev.db "SELECT status, COUNT(*) FROM course_outcomes GROUP BY status"
post_commands.purpose: Verify CLOs were created in multiple statuses

steps.name: Login as Admin for Audit
steps.purpose: Establish admin session for CLO audit workflow

instructions.human: Navigate to the login page and sign in with admin credentials.

automated.description: Login as admin for audit phase

steps.name: Navigate to CLO Audit Page
steps.purpose: Access the CLO Audit & Approval dashboard

instructions.human: Click 'CLO Audit' in the navigation menu to access the audit dashboard.

expected_results: Statistics cards show counts for each status
Table shows CLOs grouped by status (Awaiting Approval, Needs Rework, etc.)

steps.name: Filter by 'Awaiting Approval' Status
steps.purpose: View only CLOs that need review

instructions.human:
1. In the Status filter dropdown, select 'Awaiting Approval'
2. Table updates to show only CLOs awaiting approval (should be 2 CLOs)

expected_results: Statistics update to reflect filtered view
Both CLOs show 'Awaiting Approval' status badge

steps.name: View CLO Details
steps.purpose: Review CLO assessment data before approval

instructions.human:
1. Click 'View' button on the first CLO in the 'Awaiting Approval' section
2. Review the CLO details modal:
   - Course information
   - CLO description
   - Assessment data
   - Student performance metrics
3. Note the action buttons: Approve, Request Rework, Mark as NCI, Close

expected_results: Action buttons are present at bottom

steps.name: Export Current View to CSV

instructions.human:
1. Close the CLO details modal if still open
2. Click the 'Export Current View' button
3. A CSV file will download automatically
4. The CSV contains columns: Course, CLO Number, Description, Status, Instructor, Last Modified

expected_results: CSV contains all CLOs currently filtered in the view

steps.name: Filter by 'All Statuses'
steps.purpose: View complete CLO landscape across all statuses

instructions.human:
1. Change the Status filter to 'All Statuses'
2. Observe all 5 CLOs now visible:
   - 2 Awaiting Approval
   - 1 Approved
   - 1 Needs Rework
   - 1 Never Coming In

expected_results: Statistics cards show correct counts for each status

steps.name: Review Dashboard KPIs
steps.purpose: Show that audit actions feed back into dashboard metrics

instructions.human:
1. Navigate back to the Dashboard
2. Observe the 'Assessment Progress' panel
3. Note the CLO approval statistics reflect the audit state:
   - Approved count
   - Pending count
   - Needs Rework count
   - NCI count

expected_results: Assessment Progress panel shows current state
CLO status distribution reflects audit work

steps.name: Demo Complete
steps.purpose: Wrap up and highlight key takeaways

instructions.human:
Demo complete! Key points demonstrated:

✅ Natural-key session model (stable across reseeds)
✅ Program and course management (edit, duplicate, multi-program attachment)
✅ Faculty invitation and assessment submission
✅ CLO workflow with multiple approval states
✅ Audit dashboard with filtering and export
✅ Closed-loop feedback (audit actions → dashboard KPIs)

The system successfully manages a complete semester assessment cycle from configuration through audit close-out.
